title: Quick Guide on Growing SRIRACHA PEPPER (Capsicum annuum): Planting & Care Tips!

tasks.task: Planting Sriracha peppers in a garden.
subtasks: Starting seeds indoors 8-10 weeks before the last frost date.
Ensuring a warm environment (70-80 degrees Fahrenheit) for seed germination.
Transplanting seedlings when outdoor temperatures are consistently above 60 degrees Fahrenheit.
Spacing plants 18-24 inches apart in full sun (at least 6-8 hours per day).
Maintaining well-draining, organic-rich soil with pH between 6.0-6.8.
Watering regularly and keeping the soil moist but not waterlogged.

Ensuring proper soil pH (6.0-6.8) and richness in organic matter.

Checking for pests such as aphids and spider mites and using organic pest control.

Regular inspection for pests and diseases.
Adjusting care practices as needed (e.g., increased watering during heat spells).
